snippet: The political disarray in Greece raised further doubts on Tuesday about the country’s future in the euro zone, as well as fears about the stability of the common currency itself.
abstract: Alexis Tsipras, leader of Greece's left-wing party, effectively rules out forming a coalition with the country's two other dominant parties; refusal raises the prospect of new elections and increases the likelihood that Greece could default on its heavy debt load and potentially exit the euro zone.

byline.original: By RACHEL DONADIO and NIKI KITSANTONIS
byline.contributor: Liz Alderman contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: The political disarray in Greece raised further doubts on Tuesday about the country’s future in the euro zone, as well as fears about the stability of the common currency itself.

headline.seo: Leftist Leader in Greece Rules Out Coalition With Losing Incumbents
headline.main: Greek Leftists Rule Out Coalition With Incumbents
headline.print_headline: Leftist Leader in Greece Rules Out Coalition With Major Parties
